title: Denoising + Ben's Preprocessing = Better Clarity
description: Inspired by Applying Ben's PreprocessingMy Own Insight: Denoising after Ben's Preprocssing Leads To Better Visual ClarityApplying Ben's Preprocessing introduces noises(I assume gaussian?) to images at a certain level and thus denoising can help reduce such negative effect. (Even some characters inked from back of the page becomes more recognizable). However, the cons:  The denoising takes WAY TOO LONG. On average, each image requires about 21-23 seconds to be denoised.  The denoising algorithm in nature cause slight loss of information. However, in my opinion, the loss of information it cause is acceptable compared to its benefits.
